answers.answer: Why would they give you a section if you into labour early? So long as you're past 37w they normally let you push. I had an emergency section 15w ago after my sons heartbeat dropped too low in contractions and in pushing.  its very rare they put you to sleep forward section, you normally just get an epidural for it x
Didn't menthion I've already had three c/s so that's why..I have one scheduled in two weeks ..just didn't know what happens with an emergency
It would be an unplanned c section not an emergency, so it would be like a normal c section.

Flickan is right.  Many of my friends that had to have c-sections (eg for breech presentation) waited to go into labor first and then went in and had their c-section - just like normal and not as an emergency.  It is good for the baby to experience some contractions - helps get the lungs ready and also then you are sure that this is when the baby was ready for birth.
Ah right lol, yeah you would likely just get the epidural and then it would be the same as a normal section, mine was an emergency and i just had an oxygen mask and the epidural x
Thanks ladies , you put my mind at ease, xx

question: So I'm 37 weeks today and  had an ultrasound yesterday, I have extra fluid around baby due to gestational diabetes!  My question is I'm worried about having to have emergency c-section if I go into labor early!  Do they put u out and intibate u for it or do they do it the same way as normal c-section?  It's just one of my fears ! Baby looks great though wieghing in at 6lbs 10oz and was very active for the ultrasound tech!
title: too much water around baby
